features.name: Divine Spellcasting
features.desc: At 1st level, the mystic theurge selects a divine {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spellcasting{/g} class she belonged to before adding the prestige class. When a new mystic theurge level is gained, the character gains new spells per day and new spells known as if she had also gained a level in that spellcasting class.

features.name: Arcane Spellcasting
features.desc: At 1st level, the mystic theurge selects an arcane {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spellcasting{/g} class she belonged to before adding the prestige class. When a new mystic theurge level is gained, the character gains new spells per day and new spells known as if she had also gained a level in that spellcasting class.

features.name: Combined Spells (1st Level)
features.desc: A mystic theurge can prepare and cast {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} from one of his spellcasting classes using the available slots from any of his other spellcasting classes. Spells prepared or cast in this way take up a slot one level higher than they originally occupied. This ability cannot be used to cast a spell at a lower level if that spell exists on both spell lists. At 1st level, a mystic theurge can prepare 1st-level spells from one of his spellcasting classes using the 2nd-level slots of the other spellcasting class. Every two levels thereafter, the level of spells that can be cast in this way increases by one, to a maximum of 5th-level spells at 9th level (these spells would take up 6th-level spell slots). The components of these spells do not change, but they otherwise follow the rules for the spellcasting class used to cast the spell.
